setup.question: Which best describes the relationship between the protagonists?
answers: They're friendly but their friendship detracts from their ability to problem-solve and be productive.
They work together and are able to coordinate with each other pretty well.

Text.text: A seems marginally more likely given that this question is being asked.
The two protagonists are  Irish
and

. The two seem to be pals and are friendly with each other, but that friendliness often leads to them engaging in random shenanigans rather than actually getting work done. Their spaceship crashes when
s it, and they realize that this is
, who is a notorious space pirate. An example of their tomfoolery happens when rather than actually working on finding Gunther, Irish tells Click to take some photos of him:
. They're clearly having fun but also just messing around and not being productive.
The two MCs

. They've obviously known each other for a long time and are comfortable and familiar with one another and thus joke around and debate what steps to take. However, throughout the story, all of their progress and their eventual success is a part of their collaboration and coordination, despite any minor disagreements they have. Many of the quotes--as they occur over long blocks of text--are too long to include in this first round, but for ex. when facing off against monsters, they help remind each other that they aren't real and keep each other in focus:
, which is instrumental in their eventual success.

B's evidence seems stronger to me than A's, but B really should have used more of their quote budget to start sharing that long evidence they say they have. Each side's argument seems clear to me, now it just comes down to the evidence: does their friendship actually detract from their ability to be productive? Give concrete examples evidenced in the text. And B, if you don't follow through on your implicit promise of more evidence, we're going to have a problem.

What evidence has B provided that "seems stronger" there are literally like 5 words that they've quoted which are inconclusive whereas I've given examples with quotes of both of them distracting each other and how they seem to just end up goofing around. Look, even if they say "keep me in focus" that doesn't mean that's actually what's happening, which is important to note.
A may or may not provide a bunch of minor moments where they disagree but it never ends with anything notable - they consistently problem-solve and survive.

This is an example of that humor but how they survive - now for contetx this is a story about two characters who are chased/confronted by monsters but through Click's camera they realize the monsters are like an illusion/hallucination as once the camera is developed it doesnt show the monster.
. The fact they make this realization proves how good they work together.

It's really not looking good for A, who provided no evidence this round. A's only evidence of them fooling around was in the context of taking pictures, and as B argues, this ends up actually serving them well since it helps them understand that the monsters aren't real. A, do you have anything to refute this narrative? and B, can you do more to expand on it and back it up, and show them working together well?

All of the quotes that B has provided throughout prove that while Marganan and Hathaway have always "been there for each other" and whatnot they're still in the end just a pair of friends who like to fool around. I've provided you evidence that when the two are together they end up just taking random photos and fooling around---as friends often do---instead of actually getting on with their work, thus detracting from their *productivity* even though they're good friends.
yeah i can provide more ev to show they work together well. A not providing evidence is troubling and round ending.

Marnagan's response shows his faith in Click's beliefs. He is on board after Click's explanation and this agreement saves their life.

Click even trusts Marnagan and vice versa:
Click responds:
. A has basically conceded at this point
A continues to provide zero evidence, while B backs up their narrative well.

answers.reason for outcome: A provided zero evidence for their side after the first argument, while B refuted well and provided evidence.
honest side, a was kind of concessional.
There was no ev that I could cite
